I'm having a problem solving a simple (or so I thought!) adiabatic 
flame temperature problem involving methane.  I'm using matlab w/ 
cantera-1.3.  The three command lines I'm using are:

g=idealgasmix('ch4n2o2.inp','nasathermo.dat')
set(g,'T',4000,'P',1.e5,'X','CH4:.095,N2:.715,O2:.190')
equilibrate(g,'HP')

The input file is:
ELEMENTS
O  
N 
C
H
!Ar
END
SPECIES
CO2
H2O
N2
!O2
!N
!O
!H
!OH
!NO      
!NO2     
!N2O
!CO
!Ar
END

REACTIONS
END

I must be missing something elementary, seeing that I'm new to 
Cantera.  I've tried it in a number of different configurations, but 
to no avail.  It seems as if it is treating it as a compression 
problem involving just nitrogen and oxygen from 4000 K to 
equilibrium (which was the problem I originally solved successfully).

Thanks for the help.
